text:
e="preserve">Harris Lee Wittels (June 20, 1984 – February 19, 2015) was an American actor, comedian, writer, producer and musician. He was born in Oklahoma City and raised in Houston. He is best known for having been a writer for "The Sarah Silverman Program", a writer, actor and executive producer for "Parks and Recreation".
Wittels died in Los Angeles on February 19, 2015 at the age of 30.
